laboratory_examinations.findings: At 20 months, blood glucose was 2.6 mmol/L (47 mg/dL) during hypoglycemic symptoms.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypoglycemia resolved by age 6; no further symptoms of hypoglycemia.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Inappropriate suppression of ketone production at 3 months.
Blood glucose was 1.1 mmol/L (20 mg/dL) during a hypoglycemic seizure.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 10 months, blood glucose increase of 3.3 mmol/L (60 mg/dL) after glucagon.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal adaptation to fasting; no additional evidence of hyperinsulinism.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hyperinsulinism was controlled on diazoxide and subsequently resolved.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma insulin level was 52 pmol/L (7.5 ÂµU/mL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Treatment successfully controlled hyperinsulinism on diazoxide.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Abundant cytoplasmic glycogen with mild portal inflammation and fibrosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 6, mildly elevated liver transaminases and mild hepatomegaly were still present.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated plasma alkaline phosphatase at 1 year.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Elevation persisted despite improvement of rickets.
